RESPONSE TEXT: I'm getting too old for this job.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Maria: Mark, you were too old for it a decade ago.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Maria: I keep telling you we need to get some help. Younger help.
RESPONSE TEXT: They don't just grow on trees you know.
Nobody in the Vault wants to help run this place.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Maria: Patience, old man. We'll find someone.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Maria: Remind me to drop by Priscilla's lab and pick some up.
RESPONSE TEXT: Prissy told me only the turnips are ripe. And nobody likes turnips. Not even Austin.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Maria: Well, they'll just have to make do. And stop calling her Prissy. I think she prefers Dr. Penske to that anyday.
SCRIPT NOTES: Giving his wife a hard time / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Maria: Besides, I don't want to listen to Jacob complain again.
RESPONSE TEXT: Aw you know she loves it. Makes her feel young.
And don't you worry about ol' Jake. I'll handle him.
SCRIPT NOTES: Comforting, telling his wife not to worry. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: You just see if you can turn turnips into something people will eat.
SCRIPT NOTES: Amused at the challenge he gave his wife. / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: You whippin' up a new batch of pies today? I heard Alexis promise one to Erin, and I know how you hate to disappoint the little ones.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MariaSummerset: Markus William Summerset. Don't you go on thinking you're so clever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: MariaSummerset: Those pies are going to be for Calvin and his crew. Lord knows they could use a treat right now.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey, you try telling that to Erin and breaking a little girl's heart. I didn't realize my wife was so cold blooded.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MariaSummerset: Mark, I swear. Over forty years of marriage, you need to count your blessings you're still alive.
SCRIPT NOTES: Joking around with his wife. / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm from Vault 111.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll be damned. All my years and never, and I mean never have I met anyone from another Vault.
Maybe seeing a Vault dweller from the outside will pick up the spirits around here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I didn't say anything about where I was from.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's the old age talkin' again I suppose.
I was just thinking... seeing a Vault dweller making it outside in the Commonwealth? That could really go a long way for morale here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm from a little town called Sanctuary Hills.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sanctuary Hills? Doesn't ring a bell.
I was just thinking, seeing a fellow Vault dweller making it in the Commonwealth? That could go a long way for morale around here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You really never get any visitors here?
RESPONSE TEXT: Nope, only when we need something. Everyone that's been through here's a trader, far as I know.
Now, where'd you say you were from again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm from Vault 111.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I know she is. She's a smart gal, and maintaining this bucket of bolts ain't easy.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, I best be getting' back to it. Don't want the old lady on me again. 62 years old and still fiery as ever.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, joking around (loves his wife) / Friendly

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I know she is. She's a smart gal, and maintaining this bucket of bolts ain't easy.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, I best be getting' back to it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Maybe seeing a Vault dweller from the outside will pick up the spirits around here.
RESPONSE TEXT: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.
Some blame the Overseer, but it ain't Gwennie's fault. Poor girl just landed the right position at the wrong time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sure she's doing her best.
SCRIPT NOTES: Concerned and sad for the Overseer. / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sure she's doing her best.
RESPONSE TEXT: I know she is. She's a smart gal, and maintaining this bucket of bolts ain't easy.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: Well, I best be getting' back to it. Don't want the old lady on me again. 62 years old and still fiery as ever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: She's just a terrible leader. A good leader looks out for people and knows how to manage them.
RESPONSE TEXT: You don't know the half of it, son. Don't be so quick judge, now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: Well, I best be getting' back to it. Don't want the old lady on me again. 62 years old and still fiery as ever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: She's just a terrible leader. A good leader looks out for people and knows how to manage them.
RESPONSE TEXT: You don't know the half of it, lady. Don't be so quick judge, now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: Well, I best be getting' back to it. Don't want the old lady on me again. 62 years old and still fiery as ever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's not easy, being a leader.
RESPONSE TEXT: Truer words were never spoke, and I wouldn't want her job in a million years.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: Well, I best be getting' back to it. Don't want the old lady on me again. 62 years old and still fiery as ever.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What's going on? Why are people so overworked?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, you live in the same place for 200 years, time just takes its toll.
Until the Overseer opened the Vault to traders, we were just slapping on one band-aid after the next.
Now we're just scramblin' to keep ol' 81 together.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sure she's doing her best.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.
RESPONSE TEXT: Fusion Cores? Must be for somethin' high tech. I was hopin' for a crate of Mutfruit myself.
Quickest way to boost morale around here? Have my Mary whip up a bunch of her famous Mutfruit pies.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.
RESPONSE TEXT: Fusion Cores? Must be for somethin' high tech. I was hopin' for a crate of Mutfruit myself.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just visiting? Now ain't that something. Gwennie letting people in willie nillie these days?
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, slightly surprised and curious. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, hold on there. You got yourself a Vault suit. Where you say you were from again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm from Vault 111.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Back off grandpa. I don't have time for you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Watch your tongue, young man. You should treat your elders with more respect.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm from Vault 111.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Back off grandpa. I don't have time for you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Watch your tongue, young lady. You should treat your elders with more respect.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm from Vault 111.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm afraid that information's classified, sir. If I told you, I'd have to kill you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ha! Gwennie let in a good one. That sense of humor is just what this Vault needs.
DIALOGUE AFTER: MarkSummerset: The people here, they're a bit overworked these days.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Come again? What do you mean?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, Gwennie... Oops, I mean "the Overseer" never lets anyone in unless we need something.
I figured someone put in a request with her if we got a new face in the Vault.
Lord knows we could use some help around.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.

RESPONSE TEXT: Another new face in the Vault, eh? What is it we're needin' now, fella?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.

RESPONSE TEXT: Another new face in the Vault, eh? What is it we're needin' now, missy?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I gave some Fusion Cores to the Overseer.

RESPONSE TEXT: Hungry? Sunshine Diner opens in the morning. Maria'll get you squared away.
Everyone's working around the clock these days.
Another long day in Vault 81.
All these people working hard, makes an old man feel bad.
Careful running around the Vault. Lots of maintenance going on.
Heard you were down in that secret Vault-Tec area. Can't believe we had a whole colony of Mole Rats living right next door.
Boy, I can't remember ever losing a child in 81. It's gonna take a long while for folks to move on after this one.
SCRIPT NOTES: Sad over the loss of the child Austin. / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: Maria's head just ain't in it today. She's got her mind on Austin stuck down in the medical center.
Hungry? Talk to Maria. She makes the best pies in the Vault.
I tell ya, long as Maria's around, ain't no one in this Vault gonna go hungry.
If you're hungry, Maria can rustle you up some chow.
I gotta say, being married to the best baker in 81 sure has its perks.
Wonder when Prissy's next crop is due. Sure could use some fresh veggies.
Well?
Don't think too hard now.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, waiting for player response / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: I sure ain't getting any younger.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, waiting for player response / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Old man boring you?
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly, waiting for player response / Friendly
